title: Maps: Power Outages and Wildfires in California
text:
Pacific Gas and Electric said it planned to shut off power to nearly a million homes and businesses in Northern California beginning Saturday afternoon in an attempt to prevent additional wildfires.

Areas Where Power Could Be Shut Off Potential outage data as of 1 p.m. California time. | Source: Pacific Gas and Electric

Late Saturday morning, Sonoma County officials ordered 50,000 residents to evacuate. About 43,000 more people were under an evacuation warning, which extended from the Santa Rosa suburbs to the Pacific Coast, said Meda Freeman, a county spokeswoman.

Evacuation Areas Evacuation orders as of 1 p.m. California time. Fire perimeter is from Oct. 25, 2019. | Source: Sonoma County, Cal Fire

The Kincade fire in Sonoma County started Wednesday and has been fueled by the steep topography of the densely forested area. Strong winds, forecasted to reach 80 miles per hour this weekend, were part of the reasoning behind the power shut offs.

Kincade Fire in Sonoma County Fire perimeter is from Oct. 25, 2019. | Source: Cal Fire

In Southern California, a fire in Los Angeles County that began on Thursday had forced 50,000 people to evacuate the area.
description: Power could be cut off to nearly a million customers across wide swaths of Northern California in an attempt to prevent additional wildfires.
